item.title: How do i use nextInt again?
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

If you mean the Random class’s nextInt, do you mean something like this…

[code]import java.util.Random; // This is the Random class.

public class NextIntTest {

public static void main(String[] args) {
	try {
		Random random = new Random(); // This is initilizing the Random class.
		int i = random.nextInt(3); // This sets our ints max value as 3.
		if(i == 0) { // This is basically saying, if the randoms int equals 0.
			System.out.println("The randomizor chose 0 out of 3");
		}
		else if(i == 1) { // This is basically saying, if the randoms int equals 1.
			System.out.println("The randomizor chose 1 out of 3");
		}
		else if(i == 2) { // This is basically saying, if the randoms i equals 2.
			System.out.println("The randomizor chose 2 out of 3");
		}
		Thread.sleep(1500);
		
		System.out.println("Ohk, continuing.");
		int k = random.nextInt(2); // This time, k's max value is 2.
		if(k == 0) {
			System.out.println("This time, it has chosen 0 out of 2");
		}
		else if(k == 1) {
			System.out.println("This time, it has chosen 1 out of 2");
		}
		else if(k == 2) {
			System.out.println("This time, it has chosen 2 out of 2");
		}
	} catch(InterruptedException e) {
		e.printStackTrace();
	}
}

}[/code]

Or, if you’re talking about Scanner’s class nextInt method. Do you mean something like this?

[code]import java.util.Scanner; // This is importing Scanners class.

public class NextIntTest {

public static void main(String[] args) {
	try {
		Scanner scanner = new Scanner(); // Initalizing Scanners class.
		System.out.println("Chose a number: ");
		int firstNumb = scanner.nextInt(); // This "scans" the input, and grabs the int entered"
		System.out.println("Chose a second number: ");
		int secondNumb = scanner.nextInt(); // Same here.
		Thread.sleep(1000);
		System.out.println("Your first number was: " + firstNumb); // This simply calls the first int, and prints it.
		Thread.sleep(600);
		System.out.println("Your second number was: " + secondNumb); // This simply calls the second int, and prints it.
	} catch(InterruptedException e) {
		e.printStackTrace();
	}
}

}[/code]

Read full topic
